channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Farmers see a ‘Band-Aid on a deep wound’ as White House reveals the size of their soybean tariff bailout
item.description: The details arrived after most farmers have already met with their bankers to arrange financing for next year's crops and placed orders.

item.title: Runaway boulder on Indiana Jones set rolls over Disney World worker
item.description: “We’re focused on supporting our cast member, who is recovering," Disney said in a statement.

item.title: There Was Probably a Flashover in the Swiss Bar Fire. Here’s What That Means.
item.description: A flashover is an event where an entire room is rapidly engulfed in flames.

item.title: Tesla Car Sales Dropped 9% in 2025, Falling Behind China’s BYD
item.description: As the largest maker of electric vehicles in the United States, Tesla suffered more than other carmakers from the elimination of federal incentives.

item.title: Betty Boop and Blondie join Mickey Mouse and Winnie the Pooh in the public domain
item.description: “It’s a big year,” said Jennifer Jenkins of Duke’s Center for the Study of the Public Domain. “It's just the sheer familiarity of all this culture.”

item.title: Michigan college survey says ‘6-7’ is lowkey cooked, put in on the ‘Banished Words List’
item.description: The Lake Superior State University roundup of overused slang started in 1976 as a New Year’s Eve party idea.

item.title: Trump Says U.S. Will Intervene if Iran Kills Protesters
item.description: Mr. Trump’s remarks that he was ready to come to the protesters’ “rescue” are a sharp escalation as protests over economic hardship turned deadly.

item.title: Survivor Recounts Moment He Caught Fire in Swiss Bar
item.description: Noa Bersier went to Le Constellation with friends on a whim. An hour later, he was caught in one of Switzerland’s worst tragedies.

item.title: ‘I want nice, thin blood pouring through my heart'”: Trump talks health concerns, saying he takes more aspirin than recommended
item.description: “In retrospect, it’s too bad I took it because it gave them a little ammunition,” Trump told The Wall Street Journal about having a scan done.

item.title: Mamdani Lays Out Agenda of ‘Affordability and Abundance’ on First Day in Office
item.description: Mayor Zohran Mamdani acknowledged skeptics of his plans while reiterating that he would focus on working-class New Yorkers.

item.title: Trump Says U.S. Will Intervene if Iran Kills Protesters
item.description: Mr. Trump’s remarks that he was ready to come to the protesters’ “rescue” are a sharp escalation as protests over economic hardship turned deadly.

item.title: Trump Says U.S. Will Aid Protesters if Iran Uses Lethal Force on Them
item.description: After days of demonstrations across Iran, President Trump said that if the government there were to kill peaceful antigovernment protesters, the Unite...

item.title: Survivor Recounts Moment He Caught Fire in Swiss Bar
item.description: Noa Bersier went to Le Constellation with friends on a whim. An hour later, he was caught in one of Switzerland’s worst tragedies.

item.title: Live Updates: Swiss Authorities Say Sparklers Probably Caused New Year’s Fire
item.description: An official said the sparklers were attached to bottles of champagne held too close to the ceiling. Forty people died and more than 100 were injured. ...

item.title: Map: 6.5-Magnitude Earthquake Shakes Mexico
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.
